date: Dave and Jameswrote a review Jan 2020
text: Gosta on reception was brilliant. She kept in contact with me from the initial booking and met me at the property for check in. Very helpful and friendly. The location is right in the centre of Lisbon halfway between the Marina and Restauradores. The room is very comfortable and abstractly decorated which I loved. There tea and coffee available in the kitchen and the shared bathrooms are very clean. Highly recommended

Lovely hotel. Cleanliness excellent. Staff literally clean up spillages in restaurant as they happen. Wi-Fi best Iâ€™ve had in a hotel. Download and upload at 50mpbs and can even pick it up other side of pool.Staff so efficient and friendly. Bar service excellent. Drinks in hard plastic recyclable cups in pool area or glasses inside. Big range of all inclusive drinks. Beer is Super bock.Great food selection in all inclusive with themed nights. Be prepared to queue 10-15 mins in the evening for a table if donâ€™t turn up early.Great selection of pools for adults and kids. Even a few water slides. Great swim up bar.There was no towel reserving. No need as plenty of sun loungers. Always got one even on first day turning up to pool at 2pm and we needed 5.Great views from roof top bar.Only negatives are water pressure (we were on top floor) and evening entertainment average. Maybe itâ€™s better in the summer. But in bar area they sometimes have a dj or a singer which were really good.Definitely recommend.

We were looking for a nice restaurant to have local food beyond francesinha and tosta mista (love them, but too much of a good thing...) when we found Bico Real, the restaurant of this wonderful hotel. We have had an amazing dinner, authentic, with local dishes with a twist and a wonderful atmosphere. And dead classy! Highly recommended even by our 13 year-old girl!!

Stayed here for 4 nights with 6 of my friends. Loved the hotel. I had red petals , balloons, and mini cake with a note from the hotel wishing me a happy birthday. The service was excellent , the staff were very helpful and friendly.  Lovely breakfast & lunch. The sea view was stunning, I enjoyed climbing up the cliff, took lovely pictures , beautiful view. Definitely coming back here.

The hotel is about a half an hour drive from Funchal but the hotel has a daily bus (Mon-Fri) to and from the capital and it is possible to hire a car in Calheta for a reasonable price.  The hotel was gorgeous and the staff were very helpful.  Would definitely recommend it.

We spent a week at the Jupiter Albufeira with our 2 sons, 4 and 2 year old.We booked a private taxi service through Xclusiv4U which was so easy/convenient (highly recommended by the way).On arrival to the hotel, our room wasnâ€™t ready so we went for an explore and our room was ready around 2:30pm. I emailed in advance for a quieter room and we were very pleased with it. We had a sofa bed & travel cot, the room was spacious and clean. The shower was very powerful - impressed! We were lucky to have 30Â°+ weather & the aircon worked very well.The main pool gets very busy but we enjoyed it there  most days. The AI drinks are okâ€¦. Very small cups even for soft drinks! The lifts can be a right pain, especially as we had a double buggy. Sometimes we wanted 10/15mins to finally have an empty one arrive. The rooftop bar on floor 10 is really nice, could have spent hours up there ðŸŒ…The food is average, personally we thought there wasnâ€™t much choice. Weâ€™ve stayed in another AI hotel in Portugal last year & we found the food much better. But you will manage to find something.We took a trip to Old Town with Uber (â‚¬6) for my husbands birthday/Portugal playing football. We really enjoyed it, worth a visit to mix things up. The atmosphere was great!Overall, we had a lovely week away in the sun. If the food improved it would make this hotel much better but you canâ€™t have it all ðŸ˜†

Staff and hotel was exceptional, our experience from day one was brilliant.Surroundings and bedrooms were spotless, highly will recommend this hotel.Our kids had great experience and enjoyed all the activities.

We recently stayed here on our first holiday with our 1 year old. Our stay was absolutely brilliant from start to finish! We had an early flight so arrived 3 hours before check in, but the hotel was able to get us straight into our room. The whole hotel is lovely and modern and our room was very spacious. We had tea and coffee facilities and a bottle of water left in the room on the first day. It was a shame that the tea and coffee do not get refilled, but I made do with taking some teabags up from breakfast.The food at the buffet is easily the best that we have had at an all inclusive resort! I particularly enjoyed the Portuguese and Moroccan themed nights. The pizza at the Italian was incredible as well! We were a bit worried, as 7pm is a bit late for our toddler to eat, but they have a snack bar open in the afternoon which serves chips, burgers etc, so that kept him going! We also really enjoyed the selection of drinks available on the all inclusive. The mojitos are delicious, and the beer and gin were lovely!You are spoilt for choice with the pools. The main pool is absolutely huge, and we loved the swim up bar! There are two childrenâ€™s pools and two quieter pools tucked away round the side. There are also plenty of sun beds and parasols. As mentioned in other reviews, the pools were a bit on the cold side and our little one would shiver if we took him in during the morning or early afternoon. They seemed to warm up by mid-afternoon though!The staff were all absolutely fantastic! The restaurant staff would bring over extra napkins for our little one and were always happy to fill up his water beaker. Manuel in the a la carte deserves a special mention- he really couldnâ€™t have done more to make our visit to the restaurant more special, even bringing our little one a plate of melon (his favourite food) despite it not being on the menu!We had such a fantastic stay and will definitely be back in the future!

When we deove up in our taxi, my jaw droped. The setting and property itself is really incredible. And the location could not have been better. However, the hotel lacks in warmth and finesse. There are no special touches. The room was huge, the bed comfortable. But that was it. Bland decor, bland breakfast, boring bathroom.The staff was nice and the building truly amazing. But it could be so much more.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & ChÃ¢teaux
text: We do not know where to start. This was one of our top experiences in Lisboa. A great welcome and attention to any allergies. A restaurant manager - young Portuguese - who spoke fluent English. The food was excellent, made with love. The wine recommendation were the right fit - we will defintely come back.

Had a great week stay at the Hostel. Breakfast was amazing and it was the perfect base for my surfing in Peniche. I was there early season but did not feel alone at all as there was a great crew of people staying at and running the hostel. Thanks so much for everything.

We were here for 1W (7 nights) and everything was very nice at this place. The hotel has ocean view from pool, pool bar, jakuzzi, room, restaurant and bar as well. You can eat, drink and enjoy the ocean!The breakfast was very selective, different cheese, salami, fruit, bred, cookie etc. Really good, you also get different fresh made breakfast from egg, bacon. The room was clean and cleaned every day, the room is big, beds has a good quality, i slept very well at nights (normally i sleep bad in hotel), big wardrobe with mirror, safe, fridge and you also get enough towels and bathrobe. Hotel has sauna, jakuzzi, indoor outdoor pools also with ocean view. The staff was very kind, they booked tours, you get free transfers, also free transfers from/to airport, you get picknick if you leave earlier then the breakfast starts. I really recommend this hotel, we would book for our next trip in Madeira.
Horrible experience, too noisy, construction everywhere, cars and motorbikes passing loudly every time, last time Iâ€™ll stay here with my family or even alone, not the best relaxing place to be

hotel_name: Quinta Nova Winery House - Relais & ChÃ¢teaux
text: Beautiful place for some relaxing days, enjoying a perfect view, great wines and very good food.The region is perfect for relaxing moments.The olive form this \Quinta\" is one of the best I ever tried."

We went as 2 couples for 4 nights, 20th - 24th March. Short 20 minute transfer from airport, easy check in, if arrive early they will look after your bags at reception. Rooms light and airy all with A/C and very clean. Basic toiletries in room, plenty of clean towels,TV but limited channels in some rooms, very comfortable beds and do get turn down per se in the late afternoon/evening. You can pay for a safe just a few euros a day. Unfortunately no kettle/fridge or iron which is disappointing and we would have expected this for a 3 star hotel. You can pay approximately 3 euros per item and they will iron and pop in your wardrobe whilst out and about. Whole hotel is spotlessly clean and staff are very friendly and accommodating. Roof top bar and pool on 5th floor, accessed by a lift, fantastic views over the roof tops and lovely at night when dark and you can see all the lights. Hotel is in a perfect location, just short walk to bars/restaurants/shops and marina/port. Breakfast continental buffet style basic but fine, you cannot take a coffee or anything food/drink from the area so bear that in mind. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would return

Hi, thanks for a friendly treatment again. This time with the nice breakfast included. Captain s is very clean place which I appreciate a lot. I loved again checking every morning the waves in Gigi which is 2mins walking from Captain s and you have this beautiful view from the cliff to the beach. And thanks for amazing cakes baked by Captain s staff for free. I hope to  come back soon.Jana

Waauw! What a great discovery! At the end of a dirt road, you bump into a little paradise.  A place to entice all your senses.The house is beautifully renovated, surrounded by a huge garden with a large pool. A green oasis, with trees, flowers and vegetables. There is even a little waterfall.The rooms are nice, rather small, but renovated in an authentic style. If you are planning on sleeping in, you have to take in account that you will probably be woken by birds, who make their nests in the roof above you. But this didn't bother us. It's in fact charming to get this close to nature.We enjoyed our breakfast at a beautiful decorated table. In the house there are several places to relax.The owners are friendly and speak different languages.We highly recommend this place!

This is one of the best hostels I've stayed in ever, and I have stayed in many.The location is very central, the staff are friendly and helpful, the communal area is very trendy and welcoming, breakfast was great and the rooms are lovely. We had an en suite double and it would rival any hotel. I especially like the little touches such as the clean towels and fancy air fresheners. Thankyou.

This was a lovely stay, the room, which was a junior suite was large enough, not quite a big as you might expect but certainly good enough. It had a small balcony and super bathroom.Breakfast was included and very good. The staff were both helpful and friendly.We had one evening meal here which was excellent.No complaints at all.Great spa and wonderful massage with Denise. Would stay again. Hotel was consistently fully booked.

Although the location is great, the staff attentive & friendly, and the service excellent, the property is a bit on the tired side of the typical Marriott experience. Although the rooms were clean and the beds somewhat comfortable, the bathroom and shower facilities are outdated compared to other hotels in the same price category. A slightly above average stay overall.
I do recommend!!! I love this hotel and Monsaraz... One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at!!!

We have just returned on Saturday from this hotel. From the moment of arrival we felt relaxed, from the lobby, to checking in to the hotel accommodating my request of high floor. The 1 bed apartment was spacious and had everything needed, little extras like iron and board in storage cupboard also clothes hanger/dryer, hairdryer etc. Kitchen had everything but an oven which I wouldn't have used anyway, I dont go on hols to make a roast chicken dinner but there was a hob, a microwave, toaster, a coffee maker, a kettle and all kitchen essentials. The sitting room was large enough with a table and chairs also and a lovely balcony with sea view. The bedroom was large with super kingsize bed (2 singles combined) a large wardrobe and a dressing table. The bathroom and shower over bath were great. Our room was cleaned daily.The staff were more than accommodating and friendly and a special mention to Daniella who organised our car hire for us, she is a very sweet girl and nothing was too much hassle for all the staff. The breakfast was also good and we worked out it was around â‚¬1.5 more than the local restaurant BUT in the hotel it was buffet style so you eat as much as you want and there was a great selection of fruit, cereal, breads and fried foods, also cakes and juices and tea/coffee, whereas in the local restaurants you get one serving of a fry on your plate so the hotels is well worth the extra â‚¬1.5.The pool and hot tub area are nice and clean and the bar service  is good also.The beautiful beach is literally on the doorstep and a few shops/ restaurants and bars also. 10 to 15mins walk either direction you are on \the strip\" of the new town or in the old town. I thought the Luna Clube Oceana was perfect. I would love to return and hope to do so in the future.A******"

My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel at the end of June 2008 and found the apartments were- clean, spacious and in a good location for the beach.We stayed in a studio and were located on the ground floor which although was a little dark around the corridors, our terrace got the sun from early morning until mid afternoon which was nice to sit out first thing.The apartments are mixed nationality but mainly dutch and british, the hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, small pool bar good for drinks etc and local excursions are bookable at the reception, i.e waterpark- slide and splash.The location is good for the beach, however as it is situated half way between montechoro and fishermans beach be prepared to walk a little for large choice of restaurants and nightlife. ( the old square far better than montechoro strip)I work within the travel industry and believe you get what you pay for- if you want the sea views and the bigger rooms then book and pay for a one bedroom apartment- all in all a good accommodation away from the hustle and bustle...

In fact we were in this hotel from July 28 to 29, 2013 excellent, spacious and comfortable room, with a king size bed and cozy pillows. Bathroom with bath and very good shower, everything spotlessly clean. Attentive to the extreme staff in all areas of the hotel that were frequented by us. Continental breakfast served from 6:30 AM on, but as our plane would take off at 9:00 AM we were allowed to have breakfast at 6:00 AM without asking if it was possible: just the kind attendant invited us into the restaurant and told us to enjoy!The hotel is well located, halfway between the airport and the center of Lisbon, with a taxi costing around EUR 15.00 to EUR 10,00 (airport or downtown, respectively). A 15-20 minute walk is the University City metro station, where one can go to the airport without the need for a taxi. The amount spent in this hotel was very attractive (less than EUR70.00), an excellent cost x benefit ratio. We will certainly stay in this hotel when we return to Lisbon in a near future.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Everything was perfect from the ambience and old world welcome to the impeccable service.  Breakfast was a particularly special experience and the swimming pools wonderful.  We loved it and cannot wait to return.  Congratulations and thanks to the whole team.

Great location, Staff very friendly and helpful. Accommodation good some fittings a little dated but very comfortable. The hotel looks very bland from the road but is great from seawards set in a cove with access to a small beach, a great poll and garden area. Shuttle Bus to Carvoeiro town centre.

Would definitely recommend this hotel as it provides luxury at a very affordable price. I would suggest you book a room with a sea view to really enjoy sitting enjoying a drink while watching the world go by. The facilities are excellent and couldn't find any fault

We had a very pleasant stay in your hotel. Very good service and a beautiful view.the breakfast was good too., a lot of choices. The garden with swimmingpool was relaxing. Unfortunately we could not go to the beach because it is too dagerous because of falling rocks.

We haven't even checked out yet but I have to write this glowing review. This hotel is amazing! First and foremost the staff provide the absolute best service and are so kind, attentive and go the extra mile to make your stay special. We have had a double celebration with an anniversary and birthday and on both occasions the staff have remembered and complimented us with champagne in our room, a lovely surprise....thank you so much! Our room is perfect with the most idyllic view and I thank the cleaning staff for the welcome tidy and perfectly clean room that we come back to each day. The hotel as a whole is luxurious, relaxing and extremely peaceful and we especially love the 8th floor facilities with infinity pool and its incredible views and the whole layout centred around the bar/restaurant. We had the most memorable afternoons lazing on this level gazing out on the beautiful ocean in front of us. Other details? Breakfast - so many choices, something for everyone and fresh delicious food as well as champagne if you're in the mood for celebrating like we were. As I've said before, the staff are beyond brilliant! People making other people happy, it's that simple! No fake charm, genuine human warmth! Thank you Saccharum, we will be back again, and again and again......

hotel_name: Villas D. Dinis Charming Residence Adults Only
text: Great place to stay and visit Lagos. Only a 15 min walk from Lagos and a 5 min walk from the best beach in the area. This is an adult only hotel so quiet and restful. It has 3 pools, well equipped rooms and the most stunning breakfast selection. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The hotel is clean and the maid service is unobtrusive and excellent.

One of the best hotels we have stayed. The staff were so kind and helpful and the service was second to none. The breakfast was everything one could wish for and any request was accommodated. We dined one night at Blind and had an exceptional meal.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Great hotel with an breathtaking lovely garden and surroundings. Location of the hotel is perfect - great sea-view and just next to Funchal.Nice big rooms and great bathroom with all you can dream of.Very helpful and friendly staff.Breakfast is fantastic.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We visited with friends for afternoon tea and it was 5 star service and and experience that everyone should try.  It will be expensive however it is bound to be given where you are visiting.  We were impressed and suitably wowed.We also had a tour of the hotel be the reception team which was an added bonus.  It was great to share in their passion about the history of such a prestigious hotel and see exactly what we could get if we had Â£5,000 for a night in the presidential suite-awesome!Finery at its finest-thank you

Just back from a week at this hotel.  Nice enough hotel but definitely not 5 star. The room we had was lovely  beds  and pillows very comfortable, also the view was fabulous. We were on the 4th floor with large balcony which had the sun for most of the day. This was the highlight of the holiday.  Most of the negative points raised in other reviews still apply, with exception of the Spa which opened while we were there. Before going I felt people were being a bit picky, however the management don't seem to be taking any action to rectify points raised. Air con not good, toaster is not up to the job. No shuttle bus available. Also you need to be fairly agile to go to the beach at the hotel, steps down don't take you the full way,  Only one restaurant available in the evening with limited menu. Mostly fish dishes. What we had was very nice, however we had to eat out for a bit of variety. Staff seemed fairly efficient and pleasant. Most days our room was not cleaned until nearly 4.00, and then turned down just after seven. Not efficient time management.I am being quite harsh with my review mainly due to my expectations which unfortunately were not met.Also check your bill carefully as we were charged for drinks twice. Only noticed when we got home.

Everything about this hotel was excellent. The atmosphere, the service, the cleanliness and the food were all outstanding. When we arrived a very polite and friendly gentleman took our bags for us whilst we checked in and then brought them to our room afterwards. The breakfast choice each day was outstanding, certainly something for everyone and everything was constantly being refilled and topped up when running low. The staff were very attentive and would check if you wanted any tea or coffee bringing to your table. They were also happy to assist you with anything else you needed like local bus times or other information. The location is also very good, right on the beach front and only a short walk from the Marina. The pool was great with staff on hand to provide towels and cushions for the sunbeds when required. The price of drinks in the hotel were slightly higher than elsewhere, but it is more than worth it for the service you receive. I would definitely stay here again for another relaxing holiday!

Our first impression for the room wasn't that good because of the old cigarette smell at the room entrance (we booked a non-smoking room), probably left by previous guests. We complained to the bellboy and he suggested us to open the door at the balcony to vent the air. It got much better afterwards so we didn't want to go through all the hassle to change the room. Well...we didn't smell much of it over the bedroom, so that was not a big deal.Apart from that, the hotel is excellent. Big room with huge bed and spacious toilet. The pool area is excellent with plenty of sun chairs. All the staffs are friendly and helpful. The location is good, right next to the beach. We swam in the sea everyday and came back to relax on the sun chairs by the pool.They offer good selections for the breakfast. However, the menu was the same throughout our entire 5-nights-stay, so we got a little bored after a few days. They also have a very good restaurant for lunch by the pool. I love the grilled sea bass that I had. The burger was a little dry, so I would recommend you to try the grilled seafood. The price was reasonable.

Brilliant value for moneyIn a perfect placeSo friendly and helpfulClean and well equipped roomsGood overallI've been 4 times and will returnHome from homeI love it thereSunbathe round the pool all day and out at nightNear the strip and short taxi to old townHas a supermarket at the top of the road or a Aldi ten mins walk away

The Jet2 staff,flights and transfers were brilliant.I would have given 5 stars ,but reason I gave three stars was no reflection on Jet2 but reason was the all inclusive at Club Praia Da Oura was a very poor standard.The buffet food was just warm verging on cold.There was no bottled water.The grill restaurant food was cold and dry.When I returned home I ended up in hospital with food/machine water poisoning and had a stomach infection.This would not put me off booking with Jet2 again but would never go all inclusive again in Club Praia Da Oura totally disgusting.

Overall a very clean, spacious hotel with nice sized rooms. Location is great as it is about 20 minutes from Faro Airport, a short walk to the Main Marina which has so many lovely places to eat and drink and a couple minutes walk to the beautiful beaches.The rooms have a spacious bathroom, nice comfy beds and a private balcony to sit and relax. We stayed on the 11th floor so nice and quiet.Breakfast buffet ad a good choice, the only compliant I have is that the water is not hot enough for teas and coffees so make sure you ask for extra hot water if you like a hot beverage with your breakfast.I thought the chefs really catered excellently for my brother in law who has a gluten and dairy free diet and he was very happy with the dishes they cooked for him.Spa is nice but you do have to pay a fee to use even though you are staing in the hotel.Like most pools the loungers get taken very quickly by 7am! But there are other areas around the pool to sunbathe.Overall a fantastic family break with good facilities and friendly staff.I would definitely come back to Vilamoura.

Stayed 5 nights on half board option. Evening meal only average could have been hotter. Hotel room very clean and comfortable. Could do with having 2 chairs on the balcony as my husband and I do like to sit out there at times but this was not possible. All staff were nice and friendly and reception area was bright and relaxing. Hotel only 5 mins walk from the marina which means that it is nice and quiet. Would stay there again.

Can't beat this location.  We arrived at night and Aerobus dropped us off within a block of the hotel.  It was enchanting to turn the corner and see the pedestrian walkway with the restaurants set up and people out for the evening.  The hotel is basic but clean and comfortable.  Only complaint was the bathroom - it could use an upgrade and there was no where to put your toiletries but water pressure was good.  You are within easy walking distance of everything but also have the train station, metro and trams steps away.  Breakfast was well done with fresh squeezed orange juice, fresh bread, good coffee.  Only lacking in fresh fruit.

We booked for a family group of 7 including 3 different generations right down to under 2 years old... A tall order to find accommodations that would be all things to all people. This spot was fantastic. One cabin accommodated us similar to a duplex where the other unit was a short walk away and was perfect for o family of 3. I have been to many islands over 4 visits and I can say this property is like no other! If you want to experience a forested hillside with million dollar views and a true \island vibe\" this is your place.We booked rental cars to offset the 15 minute drive to the populated zones and found incredible balance of peace and convenient location by doing so. The onsite dining was great
month: but is the only walkable food option. In exchange
column12: flowers and those amazing vistasOur journey to get to the Cabinas was full of drama with a delayed flight
column13: a diverted flight and a surprise ferry boat needed to arrive about 24 hours later than expected and will no baggage... \"No problem
column14: we will note your challenge and look forward to seeing you\" was the response. The staff helped us retrieve our bags
column15: made sure we had some dinner (even though food service was closed at that particular time) and made our group feel comfortable. While none of our travel issue had anything to do with the property
column16: the staff was empathetic and helpful.The vibe here is relaxed and professional. It's an eco-resort without pretentious flare and fabulous air conditioning if you need it. Management has embraced a stewardship and respect for the natural property and the island in general that felt genuine and inviting.Our whole group only had one complaint... our travel issues left is one day short at the property and we hated to hated to leave!This is a prime location for nature lovers
column19: or anyone who wants the booked property to be a big part of the Sao Jorge enjoyment experience. Treat this as 1-2 days of exploration for maximum enjoyment because if you treat this location simply as a staging point to go to other spots on the island
column20: you are missing a big part of the value.The cabins are fantastic and more like a modern eco-spa than we imagined. For extra points
column21: grab some provisions from the local market in Velas and take advantage of the full kitchen and private deck in your unit.We would 100% return and plan days just to soak in the property."

text: I can't remember how many times we have been back to this fabulous, friendly, fantastic and faultless hotel but here we are again.  Our arrival this time was even more friendly - hugs and kisses this time - so I think that everyone was pleased to see us?  It was delightful to see both Mr Dias snr and Mr Dias jnr again and they are still exceptionally proud of their hotel.  They pointed out all the spendid certificates that are filling up the walls in Reception and why not?I will not waste space by repeating what others have written because everything is just the same high standard so I will just give you an example of the help received.We celebrated our 49th Wedding Anniversary during our stay and Cecilia, on Reception, was a gem.My husband wanted to arrange some flowers and chocolates for the actual day and she organised him!  She organised the flower delivery for the correct day, explained where he could buy hand made chocolates and then she put them in the hotel's  fridge until they were required. On the actual morning, whilst we were at breakfast she went into action - the flowers and chocolates were delivered to our room - and rose petals were scattered on the carpet. What a wonderful surprize but typical of the kindness and service of this hotel.There will be changes soon as Mr Dias snr has bought the empty property at the bottom of the garden and will be transforming it into more accommodation once \planning permission\" is granted.  We are sure that it too will be an excellent addition to this amazing hotel.Please book early and enjoy your stay - you will not be disapointed."

Prearrival information was very helpful.  The room was beautiful with lots of light from floor to ceiling windows.  We were in City 3.  The street was very busy, but with the double pane windows closed, the room was totally quiet.   The shower was one of the best in all of our travels.  Most importantly, the staff was very friendly and helpful.  We would definitely stay here again when in Porto.  If there is a downside, the hotel is up a steep hill, but of the charm of Porto, but if walking is a challenge, the hill might be an issue.
Nice and clean hotel, rooms look OK and somewhat above, the standard of 3 stars I would say. Very nice bathroom. Big nice outdoor pool. Great breakfast.

The term surfhouse is quite misleading as it is 20 mins walk from town beaches, and a 45 minute drive from surf beaches. The vibe is much more like a party hostel and none of the staff had any idea about surfing itself, rather were more interested in promoting party boats and nightlife.The hostel does not offer the surf transport/equipment or lessons, but sub contracts them out to another surf company and charges a commission for this. The surf is only suitable for beginners as they provide foam boards and go there in the middle of the day when the beaches are crowded. As an intermediate surfer this was quite frustrating.The staff were incredibly disorganised and too worried about partying themselves rather than doing their job. All activities are an extra cost. Rooms are hot and dirty, beds squeaky and there are not enough bathrooms.If you want to surf properly, rent a decent board in town then head to arrifana, aljezur or sagres.

My husband and I stayed in the Monte de Zeca for 3 nights.Great location, great food but simple, beautiful setting.We had an appartment with 2 rooms and a barbecue. It was very clean.We enjoyed getting fresh bread every morning at the door. The staff are very nice and helpful.The information book in the appartment was interesting.The only problem was that the bed was little bit small and not very confortable.The doors are small which means you can bang your head easily.

An adequate hotel if you get a cheap rate. Our room faced the petrol station - good to watch the storks nesting but not pretty. Room was very clean and housekeeping excellent. BUT we found the beds extremely hard. Prewarned by other Tripadvisor reviews we had taken two small foam cushions with us and that saved our hips - we are active late 50s and both had sore hips after the first night so how the many much more elderly guests cope I don't know.  On the positive side the A/C was one of the best we've found - quiet enough to sleep to and works well.Breakfast is OK but evening buffet varied between quite good and very bland/dry. We were on a dance holiday and so didn't have high expectations of the food anyway but if you have the choice, there are so many good restaurants in Tavira that B&B is definitely the way to go. Best thing is the free transfer bus  to the sister Vila Gale Albacora - from here you can get to the beach, Tavira island, or wander through the salt marshes watching fantastic bird life.    We would definitely go back to Tavira but if we could afford it would stay at the Pousada de Graca - we had coffee there and it looks fab!
Very tasteful suite and friendly staff! Delicious breakfast served at the table. The port wine as a welcome drink is also nice. Very well located for exploring Porto. Definitely recommended!

Before visiting Vila Gale we read some comments about it being more suitable for older guests and lots of \Saga\" visitors.  The hotel does have Saga visitors but when we went it was very busy with mostly families and young children and very noisy generally.  Our complaint is that the evenings in the bar and pool area are very noisy.  Three nights a week the children's \"fun club\" has their entertainment in the bar and if you go out to the pool area
month: there is a \"DJ\" with very noisy music blaring out.   Therefore
year: if you want a quieter drink
extracted_date_str: your only option is to sit in the foyer area
extracted_date: which is okay but at the end of the day
year_int: you are still in Reception!   Drinks expensive also.  My Pina Colada was poured into a glass from a sort of large plastic container - ready mixed - and not good at 6.50 euros....Entertainment in general was a bit corny.  The hotel needs to take care of the needs of ALL its visitors with a separate area for children's entertainment and an area for adults who do not wish to be deafened!  Breakfast buffet was excellent - masses of choice and hard-working efficient staff keeping everything topped up.  Beds were a bit uncomfortable and double rooms had 2 singles pushed together - not acceptable in a 4 star hotel.  Room cleaning a bit hit and miss and not of a high standard."

hotel_name: Porto PalÃƒÂ¡cio Hotel by The Editory
text: Big room with comfy bed and everything else that you would expect to find in a 5 star hotel (mini bar etc). The roof top bar is nice but a bit expensive. The only thing we didn't like was the wlan connection in our room - very slow and kept kicking us out.
First of all thank all the staff of Muthu and in particular the wonderful and magnificent animators who helped us and involved us in everything to make us feel great, Boris and leyanna thank you guys
Very good everything, recommendable place, very attentive waiters, well presented food. To repeat. Next to the beach.

This was our second stay at the Principe and we were not disappointed.  They have parking for 7,5 euros/day and are right next to the St. Sebastian metro station.  The rooms are small and not much furniture but its very clean and the free breakfast is good.  Also free wifi.  We will most likely stay here again because the staff are friendly and the service is good.

Stayed here for a weekend break. Great location, handy for metro and a pleasant walk into the old town. Just down the street for the sight seeing bus tours which are highly recommended. We were upgraded from a studio to a suite, spacious, comfortable and well equipped. Well worth booking a visit.

Excellent Guest House and the Garden is spectacular with plenty of space and very tranquil.There was a good choice at breakfast and there is an honesty drinks cabinet.The actual room we were in \India\" to be honest it didn't have the best of views as when the curtains were opened we faced a stone wall with a small gap to the side which was 'The View'On a positive note it did keep the room cool during the day
month: but I believe this particular issue should have been pointed out before we booked and the price should be cheaper than the other rooms. However we didn't let this spoil our holiday and I still give the place a five star review because everything else exceeded our expectations."

text: We are 4 guys on a football trip to watch Benfica. The hostel is clean and affordable with very good facilities. lots of hot powerful showers, free breakfast and Wifi, ps4, guitars, dead cheap Sagres lager, freshly juiced OJ, super comfy mattresses and good smelling bedding. reception were always helpful and friendly.  could not recommend this higher. i have stayed in actual hotels that aren't as good as Yes!

We stayed in Fenix during a short holiday  in May. We chose for Fenix because of a pleasant stay in Fenix Prague. The location is perfect. The metro is on the other site of the street. The room was spacious for a city hotel and very comfortable. Breakfast was very good.

Clean rooms and well-organized and modern. The location is center to most things visitors will want to see/do in Lisbon. Many transportation options within 1 km. At night the neighborhood wad surprisingly quiet. There were a lot of activities available to guests organized by the hostel. Staff are very friendly, helpful and enjoy sharing experiences.

Do you like food?Do you like beers and sangria?Do you like FUN?Come to this hostel. The moment after ringing the doorbell to get buzzed into the building, you enter this majestic hostel. Greeted with a friendly reception, the hostel itself also bodes with an inviting warmth and community.Included in the Price: Free Breakfast (you just have to clean your dishes in the kitchen yourself after). For 10 euro each night - recieve a 4 course dinner: starter usually being some type of bread and dip; second course, a soup; followed by a main (typically, cod, chicken, or some pork, but is always delicious); finally concluding with a dessert. During this time, you can also fill yourself up on free beer or sangria! What a deal!.....BUT WAIT....there's more!!!Basically, you can sign up anytime before 11:30 to join the pubcrawl that leaves from the hostel. Of course, prior to leaving, the Hostel pours a shot for each person; preceding the shot is a chant.The pubcrawl starts at 2 bars, followed by a club. I have neglected some of my memory during these pubcrawls for obvious reasons - they're too fun!!! But, here is what I DO remember:The free beer and sangria continues into the first bar.The second bar, a free shot is usually given and any other drinks are bought. However!!! I believe, there are also nights that free drinks continues onto the second bar too (I'm not totally sure haha)The final destination - a club - is usually late at night; but, they usually try to save the best for last. By this time, not many drinks are needed anymore; if they are, they must be bought.The entire Hostel is such a friendly environment. Everyone quickly becomes friends, brought together with food and drinks or just good times!Free walking tour every morning leaves from the hostel @ 10:30. One day the tour will cover the east side of town; the next day will the west side of town.There are also tours offered by the Hostel to amazing locations around and close to Lisbon.The Hostel is located two blocks from the water, and only 1 block from PraÃƒÂ§a do ComÃƒÂ©rcio (the main public square in Lisbon).I could talk all day about this amazing hostel all day! If you are staying anywhere in Portugal, make note to stay here.

Great location with a large park just across the street. The room was good overall and decent size. A floor lamp apparently had a bad switch and I finally had to unplug it to turn it off at night. The bed is hard but manageable. The biggest issue was that I mistakenly used my room key at the room next door and it opened. A very surprised and startled guest greeted me. This is a huge security concern which I reported to the desk.

It's a nice hotel, especially for businesses travels as it is located just above the metro station.anyway it is not far from the center of Lisbon (10-15 min walking in a nice boulevard)The rooms are quite big and clean but a bit darker.Breakfast is excellent with wide range of choices.Staff is helpful.

I stayed 2 separate nights in 2 different rooms, both Saturday nights. Hotel Algeria was perfect in every way - charming decor, comfortable beds, good showers, noise-canceling windows, and amazing front desk staff. As a solo female I felt quite safe walking in the neighborhood which was within easy walking access to the heart of the city. Thanks for a memorable stay!

The building has been beautifully converted from a hospital to a wonderful hotel. We had probably one of the best rooms (426) on the fourth floor with a view over the whole city.The staff were friendly and the breakfast up to the usual Pestana standard.It was a short walk into the city and with help from the reception staff we visited many areas of the city. It is a city which they are rightly proud of with many narrow streets and back lanes with small shops.

Second visit to the Pestana hotel/guesthouse Viseu. I always feel welcome with very professional operators, whether at the reception, restaurant, bar or at the pool bar (Ismael makes a good cocktail). To the next.

Had a fantastic stay here at the Casa Teresa. The owners are so helpful and welcoming nothing too much trouble. Everything in the villa was so clean like home from home. The pool area was kept clean and very friendly families around the pool who love it there and return year after year and i can see why! The apartments ate situated in a great place close to restaurants and the main square which have entertainment on every night down by the beach. Will definitely be returning! Thank you Dieter and Sigi.

This palace is a former hospital but it looks more like a place for Royals.  It sits in the hills in a charming little city.  The hotel has outstanding amenities like a spa with sauna, hot tub and indoor pool.  The outdoor pool is gorgeous with a view not to be missed.  Our room has two floors and floor to ceiling windows.  It is magnificent.  The bathroom is wonderful with all the amenities you could ask for.  The staff is very helpful and accommodating.  We will definitely return to this city and this wonderful hotel.
